column4: JasseT: start with memtest - let it run over night.  mainly because it is very easy.
I am guessing that was meant for me?
hold shift down when you boot, it is an option off the grub menu
server kinda imples you have a lan.  there is a way to get kernel panic stuff sent to a network port.. just a sec...
any other suggestions? This would be the first time I have ever had RAM go bad on me.
yeah, this is on a LAN
er, replace shaz with an IP/host name of another box on your lan
and on that box, run: netcat -u -l -p 6666
that printf "start..." will come up on the other box.  which verifies the pipe is hooked up right
about this script, I am not seeing it resident in memory after running on the failing server
that is to say, no ps uax |grep net returns
modprobe inserts a module into the kernel.  so you won't see a process.
